articles.author: Xinghui Kok, Jun Yong
articles.description: Singaporeans were voting in an election on Saturday almost certain to perpetuate the unbroken rule of the People's Action Party, in a test of public approval for the new prime minister as the city-state braces for economic turbulence from a global trade war.
articles.title: Singapore votes in test of ruling party's monopoly

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel called on Qatar, a key mediator between Israel and Hamas, to "stop playing both sides with its double talk and decide if it's on the side of civilization or if it's on the side of Hamas", the Israeli Prime Minister's office said on Saturday.
articles.title: Israel calls on Qatar to 'stop playing both sides' in Gaza talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said on Saturday he was considering proposing a national referendum over the country's budget, given concerns that big cost-cutting plans could result in widespread protests.
articles.title: French PM: considering referendum proposal on budget

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has inspected an "important" tank factory and touted "great progress in the core technology of Korean-style tanks," state media KCNA said on Sunday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim visits tank factory, touts progress in Korean-style tanks

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: President Donald Trump posted an AI-generated photo showing himself as the pope ahead of this week's gathering of cardinals to choose a new leader of the 1.4-billion-strong Catholic Church, and just days after he joked he would "like to be pope".
articles.title: Trump posts AI-generated photo of himself as pope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military was issuing call-up notices to thousands of reservists on Saturday to support an expansion of its offensive in Gaza, Israeli media reported, after the prime minister announced that his upcoming visit to Azerbaijan was postponed.
articles.title: Israeli military issues thousands of call-up notices, local media report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Saturday that U.S. President Donald Trump had proposed sending U.S. troops to Mexico to combat drug trafficking, but said she had rejected that offer because "sovereignty is not for sale."
articles.title: Sheinbaum says she rejected Trump's offer to send troops to Mexico

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's King Charles and senior royals will join veterans and crowds to watch a grand military parade and flypast at the start of four days of commemorations to mark the 80th anniversary of "VE Day" - the end of fighting in Europe in World War Two.
articles.title: King Charles and royals gather for military parade to mark VE Day anniversary

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's centre-left Labor Party was projected to win over the conservative opposition, Sky News Australia and the Australian Broadcasting Corporation said as early vote counting showed Labor in a strong position.
articles.title: Labor wins Australia election, broadcasters ABC, Sky News Australia say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's conservative People Power Party picked former labour minister Kim Moon-soo as its candidate for the June 3 presidential election, which was called after the removal of Yoon Suk Yeol over his failed martial law attempt.
articles.title: South Korea's conservative party picks Kim Moon-soo as presidential candidate
